body: // See https://stackoverflow.com/a/11444416 for more information about 'const' & 'let'
console.log(${x:x} + ${y:y}); // Should print the sum of '${x:x}' and '${y:y}' to the console
console.log(${string:string}); // Should print the value of '${string:string}' to the console
// For more informations on backticks see https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/template_strings
// Try changing ${x:x} and ${y:y} to fit the if statement
console.log(`${${x:x}} to the power of ${${y:y}} is not ${${x:x} ** ${y:y}}`);
// You can use 'Math.pow(base, exponent)' or 'base ** exponent' (the '**' operator is faster than using Math.pow())
console.log(`${${x:x}} to the power of ${${y:y}} is ${${x:x} ** ${y:y}}`);
